metadata.Title: CVE-2019-18601 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
OpenAFS before 1.6.24 and 1.8.x before 1.8.5 is prone to denial of service from unserialized data access because remote attackers can make a series of VOTE_Debug RPC calls to crash a database server within the SVOTE_Debug RPC handler.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18601` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libafsauthent2 - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
libafsrpc2 - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
libkopenafs2 - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
openafs-client - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
openafs-dbserver - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
openafs-fileserver - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
openafs-fuse - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
openafs-krb5 - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
openafs-modules-dkms - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
openafs-modules-source - 1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openafs package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8.8.1-3ubuntu2').
